bill_title: revise the privilege on communications to clergyman to include certain lay ministers.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the privilege on communications to clergyman to include certain lay ministers. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 19-13-16 be amended to read as follows: 19-13-16. As used in § § 19-13-16 to 19-13-18, inclusive: (1) A "clergyman" is a minister, priest, rabbi, accredited Christian Science practitioner, or other similar functionary of a religious organization, or an individual reasonably believed so to be by the person consulting him the clergyman . (2) A communication is "confidential" if made privately and not intended for further disclosure except to other persons present in furtherance of the purpose of the communication. (3) A "lay minister" is a person working as a spiritual advisor under the supervision of a clergyman. Section 2. That § 19-13-17 be amended to read as follows: 19-13-17. A person has a privilege to refuse to disclose and to prevent another from disclosing a confidential communication by the person to a clergyman or a lay minister in his the clergyman's or lay person's professional character as spiritual adviser. Section 3. That § 19-13-18 be amended to read as follows: 19-13-18. The privilege described by § 19-13-17 may be claimed by the person, by his the person's guardian or conservator, or by his the person's personal representative if he the person is deceased. The person who was the clergyman or the lay minister at the time of the communication is presumed to have authority to claim the privilege but only on behalf of the communicant.
